channel.title: Bloomberg Technology
channel.copyright: Copyright 2025 BLOOMBERG L.P. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED

item.title: Jony Ive’s OpenAI Deal Puts Pressure on Apple to Find Next Big Thing
item.description: Jony Ive’s deal with OpenAI should cause major shockwaves at Apple, especially after a design-team brain drain and struggles in artificial intelligence. Also: Apple plans Meta-like smart glasses for late next year, and Trump threatens a 25% smartphone tariff. Looking ahead to WWDC, we have the latest details on the company’s operating system redesign plan and what’s likely to be its biggest AI announcement.
item.dc:creator: Mark Gurman

media:content.media:description: CUPERTINO, CA - SEPTEMBER 12: Apple chief design officer Jony Ive (L) and Apple CEO Tim Cook inspect the new iPhone XR during an Apple special event at the Steve Jobs Theatre on September 12, 2018 in Cupertino, California. Apple released three new versions of the iPhone and an update Apple Watch. (Photo by Justin Sullivan/Getty Images)

item.title: Pakistan Allocates 2,000-MW Capacity to Power Bitcoin Mining
item.description: Pakistan has allocated 2,000 megawatts of electricity in the first phase of a national push to support Bitcoin mining and AI data centers, as the country moves to legalize cryptocurrency and attract foreign investments.
item.dc:creator: Faseeh Mangi, Ashutosh Joshi

media:content.media:description: Pedestrians walk under a Bitcoin cryptocurrency symbol displayed at a cryptocurrency exchange shop in Pristina on January 17, 2022. - Kosovo police on January 8 seized hundreds of cryptocurrency mining machines and arrested one person in the tense ethnic-Serb majority north as the country suffered an energy crisis. Cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin are created through solving complex equations -- an endeavour that consumes enormous amounts of energy. Tensions between the Serb-majority area and the ethnic Albanian majority government are running high and Kosovo's government on Tuesday brought in a temporary ban on cryptocurrency mining in an effort to bring down electricity consumption. (Photo by Armend NIMANI / AFP) (Photo by ARMEND NIMANI/AFP via Getty Images) Photographer: Armend Nimani/AFP

item.title: Brin’s Mystery $700 Million Stock Gift Went to Philanthropies
item.description: Sergey Brin’s mystery gift this week of Alphabet Inc. shares valued at almost $700 million went to a trio of philanthropic organizations, according to a spokesperson for his family office.
item.dc:creator: Biz Carson

media:content.media:description: Sergey Brin attends the 11th Breakthrough Prize ceremony at Barker Hangar in Santa Monica, California, on April 5, 2025.

item.title: Musk Vows to be ‘Super Focused’ on Companies Amid X Outages
item.description: Billionaire Elon Musk said he needs to be “super focused” on his companies, pointing to issues at X as evidence of a need for “major” improvement at the social network.
item.dc:creator: Valentine Baldassari

media:content.media:description: Elon Musk, chief executive officer of Tesla Inc., during a cabinet meeting at the White House in Washington, DC, US, on Thursday, April 10, 2025. US President Donald Trump said he is looking to allow undocumented farm and hospitality industry workers to leave the US for a short period of time and reenter the country legally, a bid to address concerns about labor shortages from his crackdown on undocumented migration.

item.title: X Down as Thousands Report Issues With Social Media Platform
item.description: The social media platform X, formerly known as Twitter, experienced an outage on Saturday as users reported issues with the site.

media:content.media:description: The Twitter logo on a smartphone arranged in Germantown, New York, US, on Monday, July 24, 2023. Elon Musk has changed Twitter's logo, replacing its signature blue bird with a stylized X as part of the billionaire's vision of transforming the 17-year-old service into an everything app.

item.title: Alibaba Chair Says Asian Firms Can Seek Growth Outside US
item.description: Alibaba Group Holding Ltd. Chairman Joe Tsai said Asian companies can look to inter-Asia opportunities and the European market for growth as tensions between Washington and Beijing persist.
item.dc:creator: Luz Ding

media:content.media:description: Joseph Tsai, Co-Founder and Chairman of Alibaba Group, speaks during the closing event of Beyond Expo in Macau, China, on Saturday, May 24 2025.

item.title: Italy’s Railway Says It Might Test Musk’s Starlink for Projects
item.description: Italian state-owned rail operator Ferrovie dello Stato Italiane SpA said it might test Elon Musk’s Starlink for future projects.
item.dc:creator: Vernon Silver, Daniele Lepido

media:content.media:description: A Trenitalia SpA train at a platform in Roma Termini train station in Rome, Italy, on Friday, Dec. 13, 2024. Italy is preparing to sell a minority stake in rail operator Ferrovie dello Stato Italiane SpA as the government looks to dispose of assets to cut debt.

item.title: Nvidia and Wallenberg Businesses Starting AI Venture in Sweden
item.description: Nvidia Corp. and a cluster of businesses backed by Sweden’s influential Wallenberg family are starting a venture to build out artificial intelligence infrastructure in the Nordic nation.
item.dc:creator: Charles Daly

media:content.media:description: The Nvidia Corp.'s logo on the company's Blackwell GPU chip displayed at the Nvidia AI Summit Japan in Tokyo, Japan, on Wednesday, Nov. 13, 2024. SoftBank will be the first Nvidia customer to build a supercomputer based on the chipmaker’s new Blackwell design, a move to meet growing demand in a country eager to catch up in artificial intelligence. Photographer: Akio Kon/Bloomberg

item.title: Flybits Touts Credit Card Bringing Augmented Reality to Banking
item.description: Flybits is testing a credit card that will let users keep a closer eye than ever on their transactions.
item.dc:creator: Tom Metcalf

item.title: Google-Linked VC Fund Series X Aims to Raise Over $500 Million
item.description: A venture capital fund with links to Alphabet Inc.’s famed moonshot factory, X, has raised hundreds of millions to invest in the companies that spin off from the lab, according to a person familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: Julia Love

media:content.media:description: An Alphabet Inc. Google X Project Wing delivery drone sits on a charging pad at Virginia Tech in Blacksburg, Virginia, U.S., on Tuesday, Aug. 7, 2018. Project Wing aims to increase access to goods, reduce traffic congestion in cities, and help ease Carbon dioxide emissions. Photographer: Charles Mostoller/Bloomberg

item.title: CommScope Is Considering Sale of Broadband Arm CCS
item.description: CommScope Holding Co. is exploring a sale of its broadband connectivity and cable arm, according to people with knowledge of the matter, as the network infrastructure firm unloads assets to repay debt.
item.dc:creator: David Carnevali, Ryan Gould, Reshmi Basu

item.title: Salesforce Is Back in Talks to Acquire Informatica
item.description: Salesforce Inc. is in talks to acquire software company Informatica Inc., rebooting a pursuit that fell through last year, people familiar with the matter said.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Gould, Liana Baker, Brody Ford

media:content.media:description: The Informatica headquarters in Redwood City, California, US, on Monday, April 29, 2024. Informatica Inc. is scheduled to release earrings figures on May 1. Photographer David Paul Morris/Bloomberg Photographer: David Paul Morris/Bloomberg

item.title: OpenAI Jony Ive Deal Sets Record as Startup M&A Gets Bigger
item.description: More venture-backed companies are making significant acquisitions.
item.dc:creator: Katie Roof

media:content.media:description: Sam Altman, chief executive officer of OpenAI Inc., at Station F during the AI Action Summit in Paris, France, on Tuesday, Feb. 11, 2025. France's president Emmanuel Macron said foreign and domestic companies will invest a total of 109 billion in artificial intelligence projects in France, marking a push to position the country as a competitive hub for AI development.

item.title: Trump Targets Samsung, Apple Phones With 25% Tariff Threat
item.description: President Donald Trump said that the tariffs he threatened against Apple Inc. earlier Friday would also be aimed at a wider range of device makers, including Samsung Electronics Co., to spur them into moving manufacturing of their products to the US.
item.dc:creator: Jennifer A Dlouhy, Hadriana Lowenkron, Mark Gurman

item.title: Whole Foods Union Certified by US in First for Amazon’s Grocer
item.description: A union has been certified at a Whole Foods Market store in Philadelphia, marking a US first for the Amazon.com Inc. grocery chain.
item.dc:creator: Josh Eidelson

media:content.media:description: Bags of groceries sit at a Whole Foods Market Inc. store in Oakland, California, U.S., on Wednesday, May 6, 2015. Whole Foods Market Inc. released earnings figures following the close of U.S. financial markets today.

item.title: Trump Threatens 25% Tariffs on Apple | Bloomberg Technology 5/23/2025
item.description: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde discusses President Trump's threat to place a 25% tariff on Apple if it doesn't move iPhone production to the U.S. Plus, Andrew Ng, co-founder of Coursera and AI investor, discusses the skills shortage in advanced manufacturing that makes building iPhones and other tech in the US difficult. And the IPO market begins to heat up, spurring hope for tech startups and their investors. (Source: Bloomberg)

item.title: Video-Game Companies Have an AI Problem: Players Don’t Want It
item.description: Publishers like EA and Take-Two are warning shareholders about the potential “reputational” risks of AI
item.dc:creator: Jason Schreier

media:content.media:description: An AI Gamer 'Q56' robot plays a video game during a demonstration at the Bandai Namco Holdings Inc. booth at the Combined Exhibition of Advanced Technologies (CEATEC) in Chiba, Japan, on Wednesday, Oct. 16, 2019. CEATEC, the annual information technology and electronics trade show, will run until Oct. 18.

item.title: EU Set to Warn Shein in Escalation of Consumer Protection Probe
item.description: The European Union is set to issue a warning to online marketplace Shein Group Ltd. that will escalate the commission’s consumer protection probe into the company, people familiar with the matter said.
item.dc:creator: Gian Volpicelli, Samuel Stolton

media:content.media:description: A Shein logistics center in Zhaoqing, Guangdong Province, China, on Tuesday, April 8, 2025. Fast-fashion giant Shein's plans to shift some production out of China have met with opposition from the Chinese government, people familiar with the matter said, as Beijing seeks to stave off a manufacturing exodus in the face of Donald Trump’s escalating tariffs.

item.title: There’s a Growing Schism in the Podcasting Industry
item.description: At the Podcast Show in London, the industry is grappling with its evolutionary leap into video
item.dc:creator: Ashley Carman

media:content.media:description: The Apple Music, Podcasts, and Safari apps on a smartphone arranged in Germantown, New York, US, on Wednesday, May 7, 2025. Apple Inc. is "actively looking at" revamping the Safari web browser on its devices to focus on AI-powered search engines, a seismic shift for the industry hastened by the potential end of a longtime partnership with Google.
